intro: Filipendula glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth meadow rue, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Filipendula glaberrima typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
